sen.e: Yujiro IMAI (date of birth is unknown, 1843 - January 29, 1868 (uncertain)) was a rank-and-file member of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 慶応4年1月、鳥羽・伏見の戦いに参戦、淀藩にて討ち死に（横倉甚五郎）、または江戸引き上げの軍艦「富士山 (軍艦)」船中にて死亡（御香宮神社『戊辰東軍戦死者霊名簿』、今井勇次郎として記載）とされる。
sen.e: On April 1, Keio 4 (Japanese calendar), he fought in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, and he allegedly died in battle in the Yodo domain (according to Jingoro YOKOKURA) or died on the 'Fujiyama (warship)' withdrawing to Edo (according to the name on "the list of war dead of the Eastern Camp in the Boshin War" in Gokomiya-jinja Shrine as 今井勇次郎.)

On April 1, 1868, he took part in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, and he allegedly died in battle in Yodo Domain (according to Jingoro YOKOKURA) or died on the battleship 'Fujiyama' while withdrawing to Edo (according to entry in "the list of war dead of the Eastern Camp in the Boshin War" in Gokomiya-jinja Shrine, where the name is written as 今井勇次郎).

In January 1868, he took part in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, and he allegedly died in battle in Yodo Domain (according to Jingoro YOKOKURA) or died on the battleship 'Fujiyama' while withdrawing to Edo (according to entry in "the list of war dead of the Eastern Camp in the Boshin War" in Gokomiya-jinja Shrine, where the name is written with a different kanji for Yu).

sen.j: 新選組隊士大石鍬次郎の兄・大石造酒蔵物語上の最期したとも伝わる。（但し、造酒蔵は実際は鍬次郎の実弟であるため、虚構の疑いも強い）。
sen.e: According to the Story of Mikizo OOISHI, Mikizo was an elder brother of Kuwajiro OOISHI, a member of Shinsengumi, and Yujiro IMAI involved in the death of Mikizo OOISHI (But as Mikizo was actually a younger blood brother of Kuwajiro, this story is highly possible a fiction).
